cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the central Louisiana coast, then quickly inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Bayou Lafourche area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – localized totals up to 8 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (minor coastal flooding from above-normal tides)
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along southeast Louisiana tidal waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 in with isolated 8 in; flash-flood risk for river terminals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday night; lightning and squalls could halt cargo handling
